page.title: 01Rolling Country Near Gordon
page.content: Block consists mainly of agricultural land with small woods or shelter belts. Farming is principally pastoral but a considerable acreage of wheat and barley with some oil seed rape and peas are grown. Ground is undulating with small watercourses flowing mainly south eventually to the river tweed. Cattle are reared for beef and sheep for fattening on the farms on which they are bred. The block is disected by the A697 trunk route from west to east but there are no settlements apart from farms. Population is sparse and all engaged in agriculture.
